column2: Professional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement422730\r\rAll training and curriculum development activities at Vista del Valle Elementary School revolve around the California State Standards and other needs\ridentified. During the 2018-19 school year
column3: Vista del Valle Elementary School held staff development training devoted to:\r•\rAdvancement Via Individual Determination (AVID) Training\r•\rBalanced Literacy\r•\rGuided Reading\r•\rInteractive Writing\r•\rThinking Maps\r•\riPad Implementation Training\r•\rWrite from the Beginning and Beyond\r•\rPositive Behavior Interventions and Supports\r\rDecisions concerning selection of staff development activities are performed by all staff using tools such as teacher input and data analysis to determine\rthe areas in which additional teacher training may enhance classroom instruction and increase student achievement levels. Vista del Valle Elementary\rSchool supports ongoing professional growth throughout the year on minimum days. Teachers meet in grade level teams to conduct data analysis to\ridentify areas of need. Teaching staff are provided the opportunity to participate in district-sponsored staff development workshops or training sessions\ras 1) a supplement to site-based staff development
column4: 2) for reinforcement of or follow-up on previous training
column5: or 3) follow-up training for newly\rimplemented programs/curricula.\r\rDuring the 2018-19 school year
column6: Vista del Valle Elementary School's teachers attended the following events hosted by the Claremont Unified School\rDistrict:\r•\rIlluminate Training\r•\riPad Training\r•\rNext Generation Science Standards (NGSS)\r•\rSpecial Education Training\r•\rThinking Maps\r•\rGrade Level Collaboration\r•\rWrite from the Beginning and Beyond\r•\rResponse to Intervention and Positive Behavior Intervention and Supports\r•\rAdvancement Via Individual Determination (AVID) Training\r•\rCanvas training\r•\rComprehensive Health Education\r\rVista del Valle Elementary School offers support to new and veteran teachers through peer coaching and mentoring. Instructional aides are provided\rtargeted training focused on teaching strategies and curriculum content. Substitute teachers are invited to participate in designated staff development\ractivities.Allstaffareencouraged toattendprofessional workshopsand conferences.Classifiedsupport staffreceivejob-relatedtrainingfrom\rdepartment supervisors and district representatives.  ...
